Requirements

Project Background

Moorfields eye Hospital is a prestigious NHS eye hospital located in London. More than 25(not sure) specialised ocularist and admins work in this hospital. Alongside their busy daily schedule , ocularists have to put in a huge amount of time in the process of booking appointments. This is because the current booking system used by moorfields eye hosiptal is not quite efficient.
Data about patients and appointments are fragmented and stored in seperate excel spread sheets. For example: There is a rota spread sheet storing appointment timetable for a ocularist. The details of appointments on the timetable are stored in a different spreadsheets while patients'information and waitlists are kept in another spreadsheet. Therefore, in order for ocularists to book in appointments, they have to navigate across many spreadsheets and make changes a lot of times.
Another major drawback of the current system is that a huge amount of informations are presented to ocularist at once which makes it difficult to read needed and can be overwhelming. This process costs extra precious time for ocularists and admins which they could use on work. Moorfields eye hospital came to us looking for a streamline and easy-to-operate booking system to save time for their employeers.

Previous System

Previous Next

Client Requirements

We set up weekly virtual meetings with Moorfield eye hospital representatives to communicate about their requirements and our progresses. During the meeting we had, moorfield talked us through the details of scheduling from receiving a patient's referral to putting an appointment to a slot. This helps us to design the system and user interface in a way that our clients are familiar with. They also told us types of information needed to be stored in system which helps with database design. After the first few meetings, we refined these main requirements from our client:
1. An easy way to book in and reschedule appointments.
2. An esay way to view patients' information and relative data.
3. Allow multiple people to edit data at once.
4. Multi-platforms, allow ocularists to check their timetable through phone.

We implement filter, search and expanding window functionality so ocularists can see the only information that they want to see.
System will manage database rather than the ocularist, this means triaging patients will no longer be a tedious process.
Implementing synchronisation between the ocularists will lead to less frustration when trying to edit the patients information

Project Goal

Our goal is to develop a workflow management webapp for Moorfields Eye Hospital. It can be deployed and embedded into NHS standard websites as well as receive data from NHS PAS(The PatientSource Patient Administration System ) system. It provides ocularists and admins simple ways to modify andd read about their daily schedules.

Interviews/Surveys

To gather the user requirements, we conducted a semi-structured interview and a likert scale survey. Upon evaluation, this was the best way to gather the user requirements.Here are a few notable responses from a member of each user group.
